Description: Upper wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian?) black-figured pottery closed vessel; orange clay with silver mica; cream slip; part of a feline to left (forelegs and part of lower belly preserved); filling ornaments: roughly drawn rosettes; red patch on one of the forelegs; incision used for details of feline and of rosettes; two lines below.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.954)
